description: This course introduces students to physical models and mathematical methods that are widely encountered in various branches of engineering. Illustrative examples are used to motivate mathematical topics including ordinary and partial differential equations, Fourier analysis, eigenvalue problems, and stability analysis. Analytical techniques that yield exact solutions to problems are developed when possible, but in many cases, numerical calculations are employed using programs such as Matlab and Maple. Students will learn the importance of mathematics in engineering.
name: ANALYTICAL METH FOR ENG

values.comments:
This course introduces students to physical models and mathematical methods that are widely encountered in various branches of engineering. Illustrative examples are used to motivate mathematical topics including ordinary and partial differential equations, Fourier analysis, eigenvalue problems, and stability analysis. Analytical techniques that yield exact solutions to problems are developed when possible, but in many cases, numerical calculations are employed using programs such as Matlab and Maple. Students will learn the importance of mathematics in engineering.

Several students commented that the course material was extremely difficult, and often times they “had no idea what was going on.” In addition, some students believed that the homework was “just too difficult.” Apart from that, a majority of the students felt that they did not gain much practical knowledge, because the material was mostly “covered in previous math classes.”

Students seemed to think that Professor Ayyaswamy was unorganized. The professor also liked to “skip over some steps,” causing students to become “lost or confused” in the process.

Professor Carchidi was extremely helpful, and he would often “help with the homework” whenever he had office hours.

Overall, some students suggested that “this course may be better if it was taken after Math 241 rather than in place of it.” Although the material was difficult, it was easy to obtain a good mark because the professors helped with the homework and the midterms were take-home. The workload in general was quite significant, so the course is suggested for Majors only.

This review is based on the 7 student comments which were submitted.
